reporting-org.narrative: AICS - Italian Agency for Cooperation and Development

title.narrative: Coordinated child protection and lifesaving interventions to protect the children impacted by Mosul military ops in northern Iraq & retaken areas

description.narrative: - Per la componente di Child Protection: rafforzare la resilienza e diminuire i rischi di protezione dei minori sfollati a causa delle operazioni militari per la riconquista di Mosul attraverso azioni per migliorarne le condizioni di vita e il benessere psicosociale - Per la componente di Nutrizione: contribuire alla riduzione della morbilità e della mortalità dei bambini sotto i cinque anni e delle donne in stato gravidanza o allattamento, sfollati a causa delle operazioni militari per la riconquista di Mosul, attraverso attività di salute neonatale, prevenzione e trattamento della malnutrizione.

The present initiative has two main objectives:
1)to support child protection activities in 9 IDP camps, specifically psychosocial support, case management, life skills training and awareness raising on key child protection issues. This component intends to reach 4,850 children and adolescents and 6,000 women and men. These activities will result in improved well-being and resilience and lower protection risks for children living in these camps.
2)to reduce morbidity and mortality rates of more than 35,000 children under five years and 21,125 Pregnant and Lactating Women (PLW) caused by infection, poor feeding practices and care, complications in post-delivery care, acute malnutrition and poor immunization coverage. This will be achieved through promotion of neonatal health care, comprehensive IYCF, and by preventing and treating acute malnutrition among IDPs living in 16 camps in Northern Iraq.
